creditline: Gift of Tamara and Michael Root
description: large round platter with black glazing in center, with four round design elements with two vertical lines in the middle of circle; unglazed stoneware rim; hanging wire through holes in foot
markings: two maker\'s mark impressed seals in side of foot: JO and seal
text: Oestreich’s version of Mingeisota appealed to the Roots from the very beginning of their collecting years. This large and impressive tenmoku, or iron glazed, platter was one of their first studio ceramics purchases, bought from Pro-Art Gallery in St. Louis around 1990. They purchased the wood-fired Oestreich teapot shown nearby from Javier (Bill) Puig, who was a decorative arts curator at Mia before opening a gallery in the Warehouse District of Minneapolis in the early 1990s, featuring local craft.
title: Platter
